<h3><a id="user-content-hydroclimatic-conditions-of-europe-in-a-millenial-perspective-deciphering-the-old-world-drought-atlas" class="anchor" href="#hydroclimatic-conditions-of-europe-in-a-millenial-perspective-deciphering-the-old-world-drought-atlas" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Hydroclimatic conditions of Europe in a millenial perspective: Deciphering the Old World Drought Atlas</h3>
<hr>
<pre lang="{r"><code>knitr::opts_chunk$set(cache=F, fig.path='Figs/', echo=T, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE)
options(digits=2)
</code></pre>
<pre lang="{r"><code>library(data.table)
library(plyr)
library(latticeExtra)
library(ggplot2)
library(maptools)
library(raster)
library(rasterVis)
library(moments)
library(reshape2)
</code></pre>
<pre lang="{r"><code>#Created in Preliminary.Rmd
owda.1000 = data.table(readRDS("Data/OWDA_1000.rds"))
load("Data/Recon.Rdata") 
</code></pre>
<pre lang="{r"><code>my.col = c("#354458", colors()[132], colors()[618],"#adc4cc","#92b06a","#e19d29","#dd5f32", "#8c6954", "#59323c", "#260126")
my.drought = colorRampPalette(c('#8c510a','#d8b365','#f6e8c3','#f5f5f5','skyblue1','skyblue3','skyblue4'), interpolate = "spline", space = "rgb")
rgb.palette.RdBu = colorRampPalette(rev(c('#d73027','#f46d43','#fdae61','#fee090','#fef0d9','#e0f3f8','#abd9e9','#74add1','#4575b4')), space = "rgb")
my.purples.uneven = colorRampPalette(c(rep('#edf8fb',6),'#bfd3e6','#9ebcda','#8c96c6','#8c6bb1'), space = "rgb")
my.reds = colorRampPalette(c('#fef0d9','#fdd49e','#fdbb84','#fc8d59','#ef6548','#d7301f','#990000'), space = "rgb")
</code></pre>
<pre lang="{r"><code>regions.lon= list(BI = seq(-4,2,0.5), SC = seq(5,30,0.5),  FR = seq(-4,5,0.5), ME = seq(2,16,0.5), AL = seq(5,15,0.5), EA = seq(16,30,0.5), IP = seq(-4,3,0.5), MED = seq(3,25,0.5))
regions.lat= list(BI = seq(50.25,59.25,0.5), SC = seq(55.25,62.25,0.5),  FR = seq(44.25,50.25,0.5), ME = seq(48.25,55.25,0.5), AL =  seq(44.25,48.25,0.5),  EA = seq(44.25,55.25,0.5), IP = seq(36.25,44.25,0.5), MED = seq(36.25,44.25,0.5))
setkey(owda.1000, "Lon", "Lat")
for(i in 1:length(regions.lon)){owda.1000[.(expand.grid(regions.lon[[i]], regions.lat[[i]])), Region := names(regions.lon)[i]]}
setkey(owda.1000, "Time", "Lon", "Lat")
owda.1000[, npoints := sum(!is.na(scPDSI)), by = c("Time","Region")]
owda.1000 = owda.1000[complete.cases(owda.1000)]
</code></pre>
<pre lang="{r"><code>agg = function(data.set, k, FUN, ...){tapply(data.set, (seq_along(data.set)-1) %/% k, FUN, na.rm = T)}

func &lt;- function(xx) {return(data.frame(Time = agg(xx$Time, 10, mean)+0.5, scPDSI.10 = agg(xx$scPDSI, 10, mean)))}
owda.s10 = data.table(ddply(owda.1000, .(Lat, Lon), func))
owda.s10 = owda.s10[complete.cases(owda.s10)]
setkey(owda.s10, Time, Lon, Lat)
owda.s10$Time[owda.s10$Time&gt;2007] = owda.s10$Time[owda.s10$Time&gt;2007]-0.5
owda.s10 = owda.s10[Time %in% seq(997, 2012, 10),]

func &lt;- function(xx) {return(data.frame(Time = agg(xx$Time, 30, mean)+0.5, scPDSI.30 = agg(xx$scPDSI, 30, mean)))}
owda.s30 = data.table(ddply(owda.1000, .(Lat, Lon), func))
owda.s30 = owda.s30[complete.cases(owda.s30)]
owda.s30$Time[owda.s30$Time&gt;2007] = owda.s30$Time[owda.s30$Time&gt;2007]-0.5
setkey(owda.s30, Time, Lon, Lat)
owda.s30 = owda.s30[Time %in% seq(1007, 2012, 30),]

owda.1000 = owda.s10[owda.1000, on=c("Time", "Lon", "Lat")]
owda.1000 = owda.s30[owda.1000, on=c("Time", "Lon", "Lat")]
</code></pre>
<pre lang="{r"><code>owda.1000[, Reg.mean := mean(scPDSI, na.rm = T), by = c("Time","Region")]#Means
owda.1000[, Reg.mean.10 := mean(scPDSI.10, na.rm = T), by = c("Time","Region")] #Means
owda.1000[, Reg.mean.30 := mean(scPDSI.30, na.rm = T), by = c("Time","Region")]

owda.1000[, c("Mean.scPDSI", "Sd.scPDSI") := list(mean(scPDSI), sd(scPDSI)), by = .(Lon,Lat)] #Quantiles 
owda.1000[, nq.scPDSI := pnorm(scPDSI, Mean.scPDSI, Sd.scPDSI), by = .(Lon,Lat)]
owda.1000[, nq.median.reg := median(nq.scPDSI, na.rm = T), by = .(Region, Time)]

owda.1000[, c("Mean.scPDSI.10", "Sd.scPDSI.10") := list(mean(scPDSI.10, na.rm = T), sd(scPDSI.10, na.rm = T)), by = .(Lon,Lat)]
owda.1000[, nq.scPDSI.10 := pnorm(scPDSI.10, Mean.scPDSI.10, Sd.scPDSI.10), by = .(Lon,Lat)]
owda.1000[, nq.median.reg.10 := median(nq.scPDSI.10, na.rm = T), by = .(Region, Time)]

owda.1000[, c("Mean.scPDSI.30", "Sd.scPDSI.30") := list(mean(scPDSI.30, na.rm = T), sd(scPDSI.30, na.rm = T)), by = .(Lon,Lat)]
owda.1000[, nq.scPDSI.30 := pnorm(scPDSI.30, Mean.scPDSI.30, Sd.scPDSI.30), by = .(Lon,Lat)]
owda.1000[, nq.median.reg.30 := median(nq.scPDSI.30, na.rm = T), by = .(Region, Time)]

#Areal
thres = 0.5
owda.1000[nq.scPDSI.30 &lt;=thres, Drought.30.Area := sum(!is.na(nq.scPDSI.30))/sum(unique(npoints)), by = c("Time")]
owda.1000[nq.scPDSI.30&gt;= 1-thres, Flood.30.Area:= sum(!is.na(nq.scPDSI.30))/sum(unique(npoints)), by = c("Time")]
owda.1000[nq.scPDSI.30 &lt;=thres, Drought.30.Area.Reg := sum(!is.na(nq.scPDSI.30))/npoints, by = c("Region", "Time")]
owda.1000[nq.scPDSI.30&gt;= 1-thres, Flood.30.Area.Reg := sum(!is.na(nq.scPDSI.30))/npoints, by = c("Region", "Time")]
owda.1000[nq.scPDSI.10 &lt;=thres, Drought.10.Area.Reg := sum(!is.na(nq.scPDSI.10))/npoints, by = c("Region", "Time")] 
owda.1000[nq.scPDSI.10&gt;= 1-thres, Flood.10.Area.Reg := sum(!is.na(nq.scPDSI.10))/npoints, by = c("Region", "Time")]

#Means
owda.Eu.median = owda.1000[, .(median.30 = median(Reg.mean.30, na.rm = T), nq.30 = median(nq.scPDSI.30, na.rm = T), fl.ar.30 = median(Flood.30.Area, na.rm = T), dr.ar.30 = median(Drought.30.Area, na.rm = T)), by = c("Time")]
owda.Eu.median = unique(owda.Eu.median)
owda.Eu.median = owda.Eu.median[complete.cases(owda.Eu.median)]

#Other stats
acf.1 = function(x, ...) {tryCatch(acf(x[!is.na(x)], plot = F, ...)$acf[2], error=function(e) NA)}
owda.1000[,acf.scPDSI:=acf.1(scPDSI), by = list(Lat,Lon)]
owda.1000[,Skew.scPDSI:=skewness(scPDSI), by = list(Lat,Lon)]

#Periods
owda.1000[Time %in% 1022:1082, Period := factor("D1.EU")]
owda.1000[Time %in% 1412:1472, Period := factor("D2.EU")]
owda.1000[Time %in% 1802:1862, Period := factor("D3.EU")]
owda.1000[Time %in% 1262:1292, Period := factor("W1.EU")]
owda.1000[Time %in% 1562:1592, Period := factor("W2.EU")]
owda.1000[Time %in% 1712:1742, Period := factor("W3.EU")]
owda.1000[Time %in% 1952:2012, Period := factor("W4.EU")]

setkey(owda.1000, Time, Lon, Lat, Region)
</code></pre>
<hr>
<pre lang="{r"><code>dr.t = owda.Eu.median[nq.30&lt;0.3 | dr.ar.30 &gt;0.7]$Time
fl.t = owda.Eu.median[nq.30&gt;0.7 | fl.ar.30 &gt;0.7]$Time

dr.10 = owda.1000[,.(Time, Region, Reg.mean.10)]  
dr.10 = dr.10[complete.cases(dr.10),]
setkey(dr.10)
dr.10 = unique(dr.10)

dr.30 = owda.1000[,.(Time, Region, Reg.mean.30)] 
dr.30 = dr.30[complete.cases(dr.30),]
setkey(dr.30)
dr.30 = unique(dr.30)

xyplot(nq.30~Time, data = owda.Eu.median, type = c('b', 'g'), pch = 16, cex = 1.2, lwd = 1.3,
       ylab = "MEQ of scPDSI | grid cells above thres (%)", xlab = "Time (Year CE)", col = "grey30", ylim = c(0,1),
       scales= list(y = list(relation = "free", tck=c(-1, -1)), x = list(tck=c(-1, -1))))+
     xyplot(fl.ar.30~Time, data = owda.Eu.median, type = c('b'), 
            pch = 15, cex = 0.9, alpha = 0.65, lwd = 1.0, col = my.col[3], 
            scales= list(y = list(relation = "free", tck=c(-1, -1)), x = list(tck=c(-1, -1))))+
          xyplot(Reg.mean.30~Time|Region, data = dr.30, col = my.col[7], 
            panel = function(x, y, ...) {
                 panel.abline(v = dr.t, col = "dark orange", lwd = 18.5, alpha = 0.2)
                 panel.abline(v = fl.t, col = my.col[2], lwd = 18.5, alpha = 0.2)
                 panel.abline(h = c(.3,.7), col = my.col[1], lwd = 1, lty = 2, alpha = 0.7)
                 panel.points(x=c(1051, 1452, 1613, 1768, 1965), y=rep(1,5), pch = 12, cex = 1.2, col = "dark orange")
                 panel.points(x=c(1090, 1160, 1240, 1310, 1990), y=rep(1,5), pch = 10, cex = 1.2, col = "steel blue")
})
 trellis.focus("toplevel") ## has coordinate system [0,1] x [0,1]
panel.text(0.47, 0.22, "D2.EU", cex = 0.8)
panel.text(0.155, 0.22, "D1.EU", cex = 0.8)
panel.text(0.79, 0.22, "D3.EU", cex = 0.8)
panel.text(0.335, 0.22, "W1.EU", cex = 0.8)
panel.text(0.57, 0.22, "W2.EU", cex = 0.8)
panel.text(0.71, 0.22, "W3.EU", cex = 0.8)
panel.text(0.90, 0.22, "W4.EU", cex = 0.8)
</code></pre>
 **Figure 1.** _Median of the empirical quantile (MEQ) of the scPDSI for Europe at 30-year scale (black) and percentage of grid cells that have positive scPDSI (blue squares). The positive (blue crossed squares) and the negative (orange crossed circles) peaks of the NAO multi-decadal index are also presented. Grey dashed lines represent the 0.3 and 0.7 thresholds, respectively._ 
<hr>
<pre lang="{r"><code>dr.periods = c("D1.EU", "D2.EU", "D3.EU")
fl.periods = c("W1.EU", "W2.EU", "W3.EU", "W4.EU")

quant.plot = owda.1000[,.(Region, nq.scPDSI.30, Time)]
quant.plot = quant.plot[complete.cases(quant.plot)]

ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data = quant.plot, aes(x=nq.scPDSI.30, group=Time), color="grey60", alpha = 0.5, stat="density") + expand_limits(y=0) +
  geom_line(data = quant.plot[Time == 1937], aes(x=nq.scPDSI.30, group=Time), size = 0.9, color = my.col[5], stat="density")+ 
  geom_line(data = quant.plot[Time == 1967], aes(x=nq.scPDSI.30, group=Time), size = 0.9, color = my.col[3], stat="density")+ 
  geom_line(data = quant.plot[Time == 1997], aes(x=nq.scPDSI.30, group=Time), size = 0.9, color = my.col[2], stat="density")+
  scale_x_continuous(name =  "30-year scPDSI empirical quantiles")+
  scale_y_continuous(name = "Density") +
  theme_minimal() +theme_bw() +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size = 14, family = "Tahoma", face = "bold"),
        text = element_text(size = 12, family = "Tahoma"))
</code></pre>
 **Figure 2.** _Empirical distribution densities of 30-year scPDSI values over Europe (green line: 1922-1952 period, light blue line: 1952-1982, dark blue line: 1982-2012). Values close to zero (close to one) represent extremely dry (extremely wet) conditions._

<pre lang="{r"><code>shapefile &lt;- "ne_50m_admin_0_countries_lakes.shp"
world.shp &lt;- readShapeLines(shapefile, proj4string=CRS('+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84'))

aa = owda.1000[Time == 1907 ,.(y=Lon, x=Lat, z=nq.scPDSI.30)]

          col.regions=my.drought(128), cuts=256, at = (seq(0,1,0.025)))  + latticeExtra::layer(sp.lines(world.shp, col = "grey30",lwd=0.5))

          col.regions=my.drought(128), cuts=256, at = (seq(0,1,0.025)))  + latticeExtra::layer(sp.lines(world.shp, col = "grey30",lwd=0.5))

 **Figure 3.** _Evolution of this century’s hydroclimatic conditions in terms of empirical quantiles. Similarly to Figure 2, values close to zero (close to one) represent extremely dry (extremely wet) conditions._ 
<hr>
<pre lang="{r"><code>owda.1000 = recon.Lu16[owda.1000, on=c("Time", "Lon", "Lat")]

func &lt;- function(xx) {return(data.frame(Time = agg(xx$Time, 10, mean)+0.5, SumT.10 = agg(xx$SumT, 10, mean)))}
tt = ddply(owda.1000, .(Lat, Lon), func)
tt[tt$Time&gt;2010,] = NA
tt = data.table(tt[complete.cases(tt),])
setkey(tt, Time, Lon, Lat)
owda.1000 = tt[owda.1000, on=c("Time", "Lon", "Lat")]

func &lt;- function(xx) {return(data.frame(Time = agg(xx$Time, 30, mean)+0.5, SumT.30 = agg(xx$SumT, 30, mean)))}
tt = ddply(owda.1000, .(Lat, Lon), func)
tt = data.table(tt[complete.cases(tt),])
setkey(tt, Time, Lon, Lat)
owda.1000 = tt[owda.1000, on=c("Time", "Lon", "Lat")]

recon.Lu16.mean = recon.Lu16[, mean(SumT, na.rm =T), c("Time")]
owda.1000 = recon.Lu16.mean[owda.1000, on=c("Time")]
names(owda.1000)[2] = "SumT.mean"

bb = agg(recon.Lu16.mean$V1, 10, mean)
bb = data.table(Time = 1:length(bb)*10+987, SumT.mean.10 = bb)
owda.1000 = bb[owda.1000, on = "Time"]

bb = agg(recon.Lu16.mean$V1, 30, mean)
bb = data.table(Time = 1:length(bb)*30+977, SumT.mean.30 = bb)
owda.1000 = bb[owda.1000, on = "Time"]

owda.1000[,SumT.reg := mean(SumT, na.rm = T), by = .(Region, Time)]
owda.1000[,SumT.reg.10 := mean(SumT.10, na.rm = T), by = .(Region, Time)]
owda.1000[,SumT.reg.30 := mean(SumT.30, na.rm = T), by = .(Region, Time)]

NAO.winter = data.table(NAO.winter)
NAO.winter$NAO.win.10[seq(8,498, 10)] = agg(NAO.winter$NAO.win, 10, mean)[1:50]
setkey(NAO.winter, Time)
NAO.winter = unique(NAO.winter)
owda.1000 = NAO.winter[owda.1000, on = "Time"]
NAO.spring = data.table(NAO.spring)
NAO.spring$NAO.spr.10[seq(8,498, 10)] = agg(NAO.spring$NAO.spr, 10, mean)[1:50]
setkey(NAO.spring, Time)
NAO.spring = unique(NAO.spring)
owda.1000 = NAO.spring[owda.1000, on = "Time"]
NAO.summer = data.table(NAO.summer)
NAO.summer$NAO.sum.10[seq(8,498, 10)] = agg(NAO.summer$NAO.sum, 10, mean)[1:50]
setkey(NAO.summer, Time)
NAO.summer = unique(NAO.summer)
owda.1000 = NAO.summer[owda.1000, on = "Time"]

owda.lr.T = owda.1000[,.(nq.scPDSI.10, nq.median.reg.10, SumT.reg.10, Lat, Lon, Region, Time)]
owda.lr.T[nq.scPDSI.10&gt;0.7, nq.Rank.10 := 1]
owda.lr.T[nq.scPDSI.10&lt;0.3, nq.Rank.10 := 0]

owda.lr.T= owda.lr.T[complete.cases(owda.lr.T)]
owda.lr.T[, T.p := summary(glm(nq.Rank.10~SumT.reg.10, family=binomial))$coefficients[2,4], by = list(Lon,Lat)]
owda.lr.T[, T.rc := summary(glm(nq.Rank.10~SumT.reg.10, family=binomial))$coefficients[2,1], by = list(Lon,Lat)]

p.map = function(aa)  {levelplot(aa, xlab="", ylab="", margin=F, scales = list(y = list(tck=c(-1, -1)), x = list(tck=c(-1, -1))),
                                 col.regions=rev(my.purples.uneven(240)), cuts=24, at = (seq(1,0,-0.01)),  colorkey = list(raster =T))  + 
    latticeExtra::layer(sp.lines(world.shp, col = "grey30",lwd=0.5))}

q.map = function(aa, bb = 2)  {levelplot(aa,xlab="", ylab="", margin=F, scales = list(y = list(tck=c(-1, -1)), x = list(tck=c(-1, -1))),
                                         col.regions=rgb.palette.RdBu(500), cuts=50, at = (seq(bb,-bb,-0.1)))  + 
    latticeExtra::layer(sp.lines(world.shp, col = "grey30",lwd=0.5))}

aa.qt = owda.lr.T[ ,.(y=Lon, x=Lat, z=T.rc)]
aa.qt = rasterFromXYZ(aa.qt, crs = CRS('+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84'))

aa.pt = owda.lr.T[ ,.(y=Lon, x=Lat, z=T.p )]
aa.pt = rasterFromXYZ(aa.pt, crs = CRS('+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84'))

owda.lr.NAO = owda.1000[,.(nq.scPDSI.10, nq.median.reg.10, NAO.win.10,  NAO.spr.10, NAO.sum.10,  Lat, Lon, Region)]
owda.lr.NAO[nq.scPDSI.10&gt;0.7, nq.Rank.10 := 1]
owda.lr.NAO[nq.scPDSI.10&lt;0.3, nq.Rank.10 := 0]
owda.lr.NAO = owda.lr.NAO[complete.cases(owda.lr.NAO)]
owda.lr.NAO[, NAO:= (NAO.win.10+ NAO.spr.10)/2, by = list(Lon,Lat)]
owda.lr.NAO[, NAO.p := summary(glm(nq.Rank.10~NAO, family=binomial))$coefficients[2,4], by = list(Lon,Lat)]
owda.lr.NAO[, NAO.rc := summary(glm(nq.Rank.10~NAO, family=binomial))$coefficients[2,1], by = list(Lon,Lat)]

aa.qn = owda.lr.NAO[ ,.(y=Lon, x=Lat, z=NAO.rc)]
aa.qn = rasterFromXYZ(aa.qn, crs = CRS('+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84'))

aa.pn = owda.lr.NAO[ ,.(y=Lon, x=Lat, z=NAO.p )]
aa.pn = rasterFromXYZ(aa.pn, crs = CRS('+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84'))

owda.lr.T[nq.median.reg.10&gt;0.7, nq.Rank.reg.10 := 1]
owda.lr.T[nq.median.reg.10&lt;0.3, nq.Rank.reg.10 := 0]
owda.lr.T[Time&lt;1900&amp; nq.median.reg.10&gt;0.7, nq.Rank.reg.10.1900 := 1]
owda.lr.T[Time&lt;1900&amp; nq.median.reg.10&lt;0.3, nq.Rank.reg.10.1900 := 0]

 **Figure S1.** _Spatial distribution of the statistical properties of the scPDSI: a. Mean, b. Standard deviation, c. Skewness, d. Autocorrelation coefficient (lag 1 year). It can be seen that the scPDSI mean deviates from zero; western mid and high latitudes demonstrate negative values, whereas the Iberian peninsula the sign inverses. These departures occur due to the calibration of OWDA to the instrumental period, i.e. 1928-1978, before it was applied to the tree-ring proxies. Thus, if the calibration period is wetter than the whole record, it would result to a negative mean value, whereas if it is dryer to a positive one. Therefore, to efficiently perform comparisons between different regions, and consequently different calibration conditions, the empirical quantiles of scPDSI were used._

 **Figure S6.** _Investigation of areal extent, as percentage of total grid cell number, in conjunction to the drought severity, described by the original scPDSI values at each grid cell. The dry (orange boxplots) and wet (blue boxplots) conditions were examined for both 30-year (a., b.) and 10-year scales (c., d.). Cumulative area of dry/wet conditions has been also presented by adding the values of each successive bin (mean: green square-pointed solid line, 0.9 quantile: green slashed line). The comparison of the W4.EU interval (blue points: mean scPDSI, orange points: cumulative mean scPDSI; triangles: 1952-1982, circles: 1982-2012) with the other 10-/30-year periods, suggests that it was above the cumulative 0.9 quantile in the 30-year scale. This was due to its high values in the range between 0 and 1.5 and not as an outcome of extreme severe conditions (scPDSI &gt; 2). Similar results appear for the 10-year scale, where all the decades of the last 60 years are found to be above the millennial mean, with three of them being in the top 0.1 quantile._

  stat_smooth(aes(y = nq.Rank.reg.10.1900, x = SumT.reg.10), method = "glm", method.args = list(family = "binomial"),
                 alpha = 0, fill = "grey60", size = 1, col = "grey60", fullrange = TRUE)+
  xlim(-1, 1) +
     xlab ("Regional Temperature") +
     ylab (expression(italic("p(W)")))+
     theme(axis.title.x = element_text(face="bold", size=12))+
     theme(axis.title.y = element_text(face="bold", size=12))
</code></pre>
 **Figure S8.** _10-year seasonal NAO values (winter: blue squares; spring: orange circles and summer: red triangles) versus empirical probability of wet conditions per each region, i.e. extremely wet conditions are close to 1 while extremely dry close to 0. Continuous lines represent the corresponding logistic regression fit for each NAO variable. The random scattering of points over y axis was applied for clearer representation. Shaded area depicts the 0.95 confidence intervals._
